website_summaries.verdict: Decent for re-tilling and aerating, but not designed to break new ground.
cons: Battery must be recharged after about 40 minutes of use

customer_reviews.title: I like it !!
customer_reviews.text: This is a powerful little tiller...i used a little gas powered mantis and this electric at the same time and this was just as good. Rolled up about 300 square. Ft area and didn't slow dwn at all. The one gripe I have is the height and angle of the handlebar...needs to be shorter and leaned back more for easier handling. It is also lighter than the little mantis but both bucked about the same when I hit some cornstalk roots and this has wheels, the mantis u have to carry because it just sits on the tines.
customer_reviews.author: brownie

customer_reviews.title: This machine is not at all good in slightly hard ground with one and two inch stones.  Chickens scratch better.
customer_reviews.text: After asking questions whether this tiller would work in ground with small stones I was very promptly assured that it would. However, it jumps and leaps just as did my Matis tiller. My chickens scratch deeper than does this machine. I removed the wheel supports and the tines are clearly bending on my first use. I now believe those who answered my questions now do not seem to have been legitimate responses.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Nice machine
customer_reviews.text: Nice little machine. I can use my mower battiers. Makes it nice.
customer_reviews.author: Larry G. Lupole

customer_reviews.title: Second unit was much better
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping that this was as good as the 16" brushless motor chainsaw I purchased. I was mistaken, take a look at the pictures. Rusted bolts and gear assembly right out of the box. Update July 20 2017. Purchased another, this was not rusted. It worked great out of the box. Great customer service too, when I called about the rust.
customer_reviews.author: Jalebi

customer_reviews.title: Product may be OK but assembly instructions are laughable.
customer_reviews.text: Hard to believe, but the instructions for assembling the tines on this cultivator are backwards for both tines A and D. This error occurs in both the Owners Manual and the Quick Start Guide. This had been the case for at least three years according to my research on the Internet. The instructions were also written by someone who is not that good in English, example: “When assemble the tine B & time C only, please just use the hitch pin to insert hole.” We are hopeful that the cultivator was manufactured with more attention to detail.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie G

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tiller for small and medium gardens
customer_reviews.text: This tiller is amazing. I was able till my garden that had leaves, rocks and twigs. This Tiller cut through everything. I recommend removing the rocks to preserve the blades. Using the Greenworks tiller felt like mowing grass or vacuuming the carpet. The battery lasted about 1 hour of usage. Very easy to put together and use. Not heavy and easy to store. I recommend this tiller to anyone who wants to till a small to medium garden.
customer_reviews.author: scb

customer_reviews.title: another great Greenworks tool
customer_reviews.text: I have several Greenworks tools (saw, mower, pole saw, pole trimmer, leaf blower}. I only had a problem with the saw and Greenworks made good on it. This tiller is awesome. With the pandemic, I have been working on lots of home projects. One is to plant grass in an area filled with moss and weeds. This tiller digs deep, is powerful and gets the job done. I suggest getting a second battery. Most of my other batteries are 60v whereas this one is 40v. Having a second battery will allow me to keep working when the battery dies. I highly recommend this an all Greenworks tools.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie B-B

customer_reviews.title: Great tiller.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on other reviews but wasn't sure it could perform as well as my gas powered tiller. Well, it does better than the gas tiller. Don't have to pull a chord to start it, no gas oil mixture to spill, no exhaust fumes, and it really works up the soil. I couldn't till my garden on one charge, but that is not a big deal. Just waited about an hour while the battery charged enough to finish. Might buy another battery for those occasions. My neighbor borrowed and tilled his garden too. He loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Tom M

customer_reviews.title: Freaking fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I have wanted a rototiller for AGES (yes I know that’s odd) but didn’t want the smell and maintenance of a gas powered machine. Got a used tiller with cosmetic marks for a great deal, and it is FANTASTIC!!! So easy to use, lightweight enough that I can move it (I’m a small woman with less than big muscles) and it is the most satisfying thing to get it going and watch hard ground turn into super beautiful smooshed up soil. A+
customer_reviews.author: AED Flagstaff

customer_reviews.title: Know what your expectations are
customer_reviews.text: If you have a small area and pretty good dirt, this thing is a champ. If you have a larger area, expect to go through the battery quickly. If you have rocky soil, clay, or areas that haven't already been dug up before then look elsewhere. I have the excellent GreenWorks cordless chainsaw so I figured at the very least I was getting an extra battery for that.
customer_reviews.author: Reed J. Richmond

customer_reviews.title: Impressive machine that is severely under rated
customer_reviews.text: This tiller far exceeds its reviews. It is powerful and fast. Digs well and quickly. Easy to assemble. Exceeded battery lifetime ratings. This is not a tool for the lazy. If you know how to properly use a tiller, it will impress you. If you want a tool to dig a hole while you watch, hire someone to run it for you. It will work you but it is well built and impressive. It is a powerful as a gas tiller in its same category. I love it. No more struggling to start. No more mixing oil and gas. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Light and manageable for light tilling in flower bed or small veggie garden.
customer_reviews.text: The Greenworks 40 volt Cordless Cultivator is perfect for my needs, small enough to get into small areas in my flower beds, time and energy saving plus the battery stayed charged over two days of use. I'm a small built older lady who loves gardening but not the heavy duty work a larger garden requires. While this cultivator works great for me it is not powerful enough for hard, dry, first time to be tilled soil.
customer_reviews.author: Linda 64

customer_reviews.title: Assembly instructions unclear - no real customer support
customer_reviews.text: I think I will like this tiller, but I am not sure I assembled it correctly. The instructions on adding the tines are unclear and the written instructions are different from the diagram. This is in both the manual that came with the tiller (very small print) and the on-line manual. This came with extra parts not listed or described, not referenced in the instructions. Attempts to reach the company and find out if I have this correctly assembled have been unsuccessful.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Appears well made. This is the third Greenworks G-Max ...
customer_reviews.text: Appears well made. This is the third Greenworks G-Max 40V machine. This item was delivered with the box torn open (delivered by UPS). It was missing the hardware kit. I called Greenworks and they sent the missing parts. When they arrived, I was still missing two clips. I bought them myself. This has been an inconvenience, but has not affected the quality of the machine.
customer_reviews.author: William Allen

customer_reviews.title: Nice little garden cultivator
customer_reviews.text: Bought this tiller for Christmas for me. Moved into new home and just started using it this season to help me establish some new beds. Works great. Hired someone to till the larger spaces because I needed them tilled deeper than this greenworks does. Had a mantis for years and just got tired of fighting to start it every time. Glad I made this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: pepperqueen

customer_reviews.title: Jams Up so easily
customer_reviews.text: UPDATED REVIEW The battery is difficult to remove, it almost feels stuck, it has been my biggest pet peeve with this unit. Today, after only 3 uses, the battery is completely stuck in the unit, I have no idea how I am going to remove it without damaging the unit. This thing is a dud! Weeds, roots, etc. jam this thing up too easily. It works nicely, but tangles so quickly
customer_reviews.author: Chelle

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, yet easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical at first whether this would have the power required to get through some fairly hard soil. I took my time, let the cultivator do the work, and it worked great. Whenever too many weeds would get caught up in the blades, I simply removed the pin, took the blades off one at a time, removed the weeks and reassembled. Was able to do this in 2 to 3 minutes. It is nice not having to worry whether this will start next spring!
customer_reviews.author: MommaSpice

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Only worked one season! Batteries are properly charged and tiller was kept inside. Cannot get it started this year🤬 only used twice👎🏻
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Missing small parts.
customer_reviews.text: The hitch latches, felt washers, and ring latches were all unpacked aged and randomly floating around the box. On top of that, we didn’t receive a bolt and we’re missing some of the hitch latches. Instead of sending replacements, they wanted us to go through the effort of returning the whole thing. We fixed it by getting a bolt and nut that fit, instead of using their latches and bolt that were missing.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Nice small tiller!
customer_reviews.text: We had a bit of trouble with assembly but figured it out. Tiller jumps at first but I got used to it. It’s excellent for what I needed...small spaces. Does a good job. Am well pleased with the way it breaks up the soil. Good size for a woman to use.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn

customer_reviews.title: Since I'm extremely happy with the mower
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tiller since I already have the mower. Since I'm extremely happy with the mower, I trusted that I would have the same great experience. I was wrong. The unit tilled about 2000 sqft and stopped working. I started hearing gears grinding and now... I can hear the motor turn, but the blades do not.
customer_reviews.author: Jae

customer_reviews.title: I wanted this to prepare "bare spots" for grass seeding on a 4 acre lawn, which works very well!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this to prepare "bare spots" for grass seeding on a 4-acre lawn, which works very well! I have a somewhat clay soil and using a hand cultivator was back-breaking work, this made quick work of it!
customer_reviews.author: Wade Guisbert

customer_reviews.title: Great little cultivator
customer_reviews.text: This machine is easy to use, easy to start, and is great for getting in between rows as your garden grows! It is light and easy for a man or women to maneuver. We've used primarily after our initial tilling is done by our larger rototiller, so if your soil isn't already loosened up, breaking fresh terrain for a garden might be difficult (depending on your soil) with this machine.
customer_reviews.author: areved

customer_reviews.title: Easy, effective, affordable.
customer_reviews.text: Made gardenbeds each side 30 foot long driveway. Worked great. Had to clean times 3 times. Added 20 neags garden soil to my clay. Looks fabulous. Landscaper wanted a thousand. This goes with all my greenworks tools. I love it. Saved a fortune and canuse it elsewhere later.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen Gabellini

customer_reviews.title: much better and stronger than expected.
customer_reviews.text: Chops up my hardened old soil wonderfully. I have several spots with old vines and roots and, other that the thicker roots, this thing runs through the dirt and vines like butter. I'm not using it as intended, but I'm 65 and have a hard time using a shovel for very long. Once I get all the vines removed, I will use this as intended and be a little nicer to my little tool, and this tiller. :)
customer_reviews.author: Michael W.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent except for battery removal
customer_reviews.text: Easy to start, easy to use, good battery life, enough power for its purpose. Only complaint is that getting the battery out is always a huge struggle and that aspect is very poorly designed.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth E Mierke

customer_reviews.title: Great Tiller!
customer_reviews.text: This works great! I already had the lawnmower and have been happy with that. The battery for the mower works in the tiller. I had no problem with assembly and they must have done a fix based on other comments because the battery pops right out of this one. I wish I had more garden space to till because it's more fun than work.
customer_reviews.author: Whistlestar

customer_reviews.title: Greenworks--excellent customer service and support!
customer_reviews.text: I have had the cultivator/tiller for just under a year and had a problem with the plastic housing that covers the battery closing. I contacted the Greenworks support and they responded excellently. They worked through the issues and we couldn't completely resolve them, they sent me a new replacement without charge. Through 4-5 emails and almost skyping, the support was solid. I have a couple of other Greenworks products, all seem to work well.
customer_reviews.author: JSC

customer_reviews.title: Good tool with good customer service.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this cultivator for over a year now, and it is very good for it's size. The battery life is decent. I can till 2 to 3 planting beds (4' x 25') on a charge. It will till 3 to 6 inches deep when you make multiple passes. Recently had an issue with the battery charger not working. Called GreenWorks customer service and they sent out a new charger . Great to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Walter B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Garden tool
customer_reviews.text: This cultivator is more powerful than I expected. Its light weight design is great for flower gardens and I use it to mulch rotting leaves making a nice ground cover. The battery will run full power for 30 minutes easily and recharges in about 90 minutes. Not recommended for a large 1/4 acre vegetable garden, but for square foot gardening or a small garden its great. Tines are easily removable for cleaning. The tines also cut right through most surface roots of under-growth. Also vey quiet running. Great tool.
customer_reviews.author: Lt. Jim Flip  Ret.

customer_reviews.title: Good for light tilling
customer_reviews.text: This tiller has proven handy for quick tilling jobs when I am turning over and preparing a new bed mid-season, etc. Easy for me to handle on my own. So far the battery last for about an hour of tilling. Still need the gas powered Mantis for the big work in spring and fall.
customer_reviews.author: lafayettemom

customer_reviews.title: This tiller worked well for my raised beds, ripping through last years dead roots without problem
customer_reviews.text: This tiller worked well for my raised beds, ripping through last years dead roots without problems. The only issue was some missing parts to hold the rear wheels to the frame or I would give five stars. I made something to work since this was not a critical part and I did not want to hassle with getting one from the manufacturer and waiting for it to arrive. The 40V battery is a beast; I can till up about 200 square foot raised bed on one battery charge and the other battery will fully charge in just about the time it takes to complete that task1
customer_reviews.author: DaFi

customer_reviews.title: If your reseeding you’re lawn you need this!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast! Tech will replace if motor is faulty. This thing is a beast, will save you hours cultivating anything. I have reseeded my entire lawn of weeds because of this beast!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: What a great cultivator, I have a 20 x 24 garden. I also have a 8 year old grandson who thinks I should play instead of work. I was blown away with the machine, I'm 59 years old and have alot of work to do and this has made my workload in this garden go from a 10 to a 3. Awesome is all I can say.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool!
customer_reviews.text: Works like a gas engine one. This one gets the job done. I used it on my raised garden and it is worth the money instead of me having to do it by hand! The battery lasts through out the 3 raised garden sections, 3ft x 10ft each. Still had enough battery to weed wack around the house and blw out the garage with the blower. Yes, I have all the Greenworks tools! I love them! They sure beat out the gas tools, which I gave away!
customer_reviews.author: ExNavyJim

customer_reviews.title: Great product but assembly instructions would have been nice
customer_reviews.text: Greenworks makes fantastic products and I have most of them. Really would have been nice if this one had come with any directions, though, since you need to know how the tines are supposed to be facing, so I didn't have to look it up online. There are like 5 steps to print the thing together. You can't include that in the box??
customer_reviews.author: A M

customer_reviews.title: a gardener's dream
customer_reviews.text: I just love greenworks no more carburetor problems and now she can do yard work if I'm not home... i hate yard work ;)
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: Really works well
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife after getting her the mower that uses the same battery. She uses the tiller in rocky ground in her garden and loves it. Very easy to use and gets a good bit of battery life in use.
customer_reviews.author: JWise

customer_reviews.title: Hard to maneuver but works
customer_reviews.text: Hard to maneuver but does work well a bit difficult and small to do my whole yard a little over 7,000 square feet but it will do
customer_reviews.author: Justme77

customer_reviews.title: Great little tiller
customer_reviews.text: This rototiller is perfect for small areas. It has plenty of power, and is lightweight and easy to operate. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: We tried one, battery charges, engine starts, but not connected to drive train. Tines will not turn. We returned, they sent another one, same issue. No repair service in Idaho where we live. So we've returned this one. disappointing to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly useful!
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical about a cordless model. I had just trashed a small Troy Bilt 2 cycle tiller I got on clearance at Lowes. The engine seized up after 2 hours use. Total garbage. This Greenworks tiller is perfect. I used it on and off for 2 hours and the thing still had plenty of power. It's not suitable for major tilling in heavy clay but it's fine for weeding and freshening up the flower beds. No cord to worry about either. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Works extremely well and covers a fairly large garden area.
customer_reviews.text: My garden is about a 15' x 20' garden area and it took two batteries to till the whole thing because it was a bit overgrown with weeds. Once it was done the first time, I can re-till it with just one battery. Great for me as I don't like 2-cycle engines!
customer_reviews.author: Gil M. Levesque

customer_reviews.title: Light weight an easy to get between my rows in my garden
customer_reviews.text: Light weight an easy to get between my rows in my garden. Did not work for my unworked garden but makes my upkeep an weeding much easier. Would definitely recommend it to anyone for upkeep. Battery lasts along time an also have the weedeater an they both work very well an easy for me to handle. I am an older active lady an these have made my work much more able to get it all done. Yaa Green Works.!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Marcia

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: She loves the easy operation with no cord to pull, or gas mixture. Works great for her flower beds.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas DuBois

customer_reviews.title: Another Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Another GreenWorks product that excels at what is was designed to accomplish. Tilled our 8 x10 garden plot in next to no time at all. Expect it do the between row tilling just as well.
customer_reviews.author: Micky

customer_reviews.title: it's iffy.
customer_reviews.text: it didn't work right away. took 2 long calls to customer service. working now. good price, and lack of cord and gas are great, but prepare for possible frustration.
customer_reviews.author: suzanneValerie

customer_reviews.title: SO FAR SO GOOD! TIME WILL TELL?
customer_reviews.text: For my needs it is exactly what I hoped it would be. I till/cultivate an area about 30' X 6' & another area 10' X 10' with no problem. It worked well in soft soil and semi hard soil. Plenty of power much to my surprize. This review is based on my first use, I have no long term experience with this machine. To be fair it would be good request another review after 2-3 seasons of use.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Everything has been great. Does great removing grass in between rows in the garden. Haven’t used up the battery yet, I wear out first lol. I did hit a few rocks that made the battery kick out, but no biggie! Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: daniel hubbard

customer_reviews.title: Better than a Mantis,Cheaper too.
customer_reviews.text: Great little Tiller.Battery lasts up to an hour or 45 minutes.I cultivated a huge front yard in no time.Then raked the dead Grass and weeds. The Batteries charge in an hours time.The best way to operate this Mantis is let it roll forward than dig deep pulling it back to you. A must have for a do it yourselfer.
customer_reviews.author: alex g

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Is adequate for areas that have been cultivated for extended periods of time. Keep it away from Bermuda grass.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: nice tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice addition to my gardening tools. it isn't powerful but I would expect that for a little tiller. the only thing I don't like about it is I can't make it work going forward but by pulling it it does what I wanted it for.
customer_reviews.author: L. Buchholz

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent machine. Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent machine. Easy to use, easy to maintain. Since it is electric, it is a pleasure to use. No hassling with gas or a carbuetor or an electric cord since this is battery powered. I did some heavy duty cultivating for 45 minutes and the machine was still going strong. I battery indicator showed 45% charge left when I stopped. I certainly recommend this machine for anyone who does light cultivating.
customer_reviews.author: Ray T Manning Jr

customer_reviews.title: Little hard to use
customer_reviews.text: The only way to till a small garden was pull the tiller backwards it will not pull itself forward on the small wheels no matter setting wheel height high or low. If it was so much trouble to break down and repack I would send it back.
customer_reviews.author: TY

customer_reviews.title: Battery not so great
customer_reviews.text: Nice little tiller for smaller gardens. Battery doesn't last more than 30 minutes however... went through 4 charges for a 30x20 garden
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: DANGEROUS ERROR IN INSTRUCTIONS
customer_reviews.text: Ignore the written instructions when installing the tines, they are wrong. Follow the drawings and use common sense.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREENWORKS PRODUCTS ARE AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: We have started a small garden, and this works really great for such as we need. We had already purchased the twin blade lawn mower and the leaf blower and weed wacker and all work GREAT! No more gasoline smell.
customer_reviews.author: L. Washburn

customer_reviews.title: Mighty Mouse
customer_reviews.text: Much better than I expected. Pretty powerful for battery operation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mobility
customer_reviews.text: Works far superior to what I anticipated since it is pretty lightweight. The mobility and depth of cut was great in my garden soil.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Borst

customer_reviews.title: It is very powerful and does an excellent job of tilling for a long time
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit apprehensive about this electric tiller until I used it the first time in one of my greenhouses. It is very powerful and does an excellent job of tilling for a long time. The battery just lasts and lasts. I have several GreenWorks tools and am completely satisfied with all of them. Just one battery fits them and if you have a spare battery you will always be able to work.
customer_reviews.author: Fred C. Richards

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a woman's use
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a woman's use! Lightweight and well balanced, no pulling on starter ropes until you are sore and cursing it. I have an acre of yard and the battery holds enough charge to do all the flowerbeds, which are many, in one pop.
customer_reviews.author: CountryGirl

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: This gets the job done. Amazing power, long battery life, much much better than gas mantis tiller. don't hesitate on this one!
customer_reviews.author: Biggie Smalls

customer_reviews.title: Worked great and really powerful for cultivation the soil
customer_reviews.text: Lots of power and it worked surprisingly well, considering it's battery operated. Good choice vs. gas.
customer_reviews.author: John Bruns

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I liked the entire product. It was easy to assemble, easy to use and did a good job. I did find that for my purposes I pulled it backwards to enable me to see exactly where it was tilling.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: tiller
customer_reviews.text: works very good with the exception of when I tilled my garden all the weeds that was long went in the middle of the tines easy to handle for an elderly person thanks
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works for what I need it for
customer_reviews.text: no more working to get the small tiller to start. It runs about 20 to 30 minutes on one battery. I did not purchase another batter, because I wanted to limit the time in the garden so that I would not get overly tired. You need lager tiller to till up the ground for the 1st pass or it will take you forever.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer margare t Jane couch

customer_reviews.title: my most recent addition to my greenworks collection
customer_reviews.text: This tool is bad a$$, does our 14 X 25 garden in 1 hour with 2 4.0ah batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and better than gasoline alternatives.
customer_reviews.text: Have had two previous 4 cycle gasoline garden tillers. They last about 2 years if you maintain them well. This one is quiet and better at tilling. Battery charge lasts long enough for a good size garden patch.
customer_reviews.author: Gary L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Over all not a bad little tiller
customer_reviews.text: I le being able to take the tines off easily for cleaning, I thought it odd that when in push the start button, and pull the wire lever back it takes 3 to 5 seconds to start then sounds like there is no oil fgd or a few seconds, it also runs a slower than I thought it would but it does till the soil pretty good, I don't think it's all that light weight
customer_reviews.author: Jerry M.

customer_reviews.title: Great garden tiller.
customer_reviews.text: Great lightweight tilling machine. Don't expect this little guy to grind up turf or hard soil, but for small garden work with good, or halfway decent, soil this machine is great. I would guess I got about 30 min of tilling on a charge.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great power!
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME! Better than my Mantis! This tiller has power and heft but is easy enough for this great grandma to use!
customer_reviews.author: CatmomMarcia

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and does a fantastic job!
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Works like a champ and the battery gives a good amount of time. Easy to use, even for a 115lb elderly lady (Bought this as a gift for the mother in law).
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Good and powerful
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use, it does it's job. Good for house yard work. Very light and powerful!
customer_reviews.author: HKStan

customer_reviews.title: Nice for small jobs
customer_reviews.text: A great little cultivator for small jobs. Greenworks battery operated lawncare products fill my garage! I am so happy with all of their items!
customer_reviews.author: BayLadyBlue

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This item as advertised and more the battery last longer than I thought it would. It last for about 1 hour of constant usage. If you rub it totally dead you need to wait until the battery cools before it will charge.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: works better than i expectec
customer_reviews.text: works better than i expectec, used this to till up about 800 square feet of lawn (weeds) so far getting ready to put down sod. worked great.
customer_reviews.author: John Carff

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Cultivator
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this cultivator. Does the job quickly and I can handle it just fine. Have worked it in the garden and an area I wanted to break up to lay walking stones in.
customer_reviews.author: CT

customer_reviews.title: A workhorse for a small package.
customer_reviews.text: This unit is a workhorse and I have run the rototiller for about an hour and a half on one charge. The speed of the rototiller is not adjustable but all in all a great unit for the bucks. Recharges in about an hour time frame.
customer_reviews.author: K.A. Smith

customer_reviews.title: This little tiller can do the job - very dependable and useful
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with how long the battery works - usually always longer than I need to!
customer_reviews.author: JWead

customer_reviews.title: Great tiller
customer_reviews.text: bought this a few months ago, used it a couple of times and it works really well.
customer_reviews.author: Danny C.

customer_reviews.title: The smaller battery lasted for just long enough to do this footprint and the ground was pretty hard/dry. Next time I am going to
customer_reviews.text: We have a small garden, maybe 20" x 6". The smaller battery lasted for just long enough to do this footprint and the ground was pretty hard/dry. Next time I am going to water it down first to make the soil a little more damp. I was happy that the battery lasted long enough for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: J Gentry

customer_reviews.title: I love this little machine
customer_reviews.text: I love this little machine. I am in the process of relandscaping my backyard and this small rototiller is perfect. I have been able to create a pathway by loosening up all the soil and digging it out. I have yet to run the battery down but then I am an older woman so I don't work for a long stretches. The tiller is lightweight and very easy to maneuver. I would definitely recommend this product if you are a gardener with a smaller yard.
customer_reviews.author: Margo

customer_reviews.title: The tiller works just fine in an ONLY dirt area
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps a bit of naivete on my part, but when I ordered this I had expected it to be able to till through some plants/grass to make a garden. My husband had to use a shovel to dig up all grass from our garden area. The tiller works just fine in an ONLY dirt area. Overall, I'm satisfied with the purchase now that the garden is completed. However, I was disappointed when I first took it out in the yard and had anticipated being able to till up a garden row.
customer_reviews.author: Adrea S.

customer_reviews.title: Works as good as any corded or gas operated unit
customer_reviews.text: Works as good as any corded or gas operated unit, however the battery life comes up short. I would recommend 3 or 4 batteries and two charging units to keep a fresh battery ready.
customer_reviews.author: William F Taylor

customer_reviews.title: great for light gardening
customer_reviews.text: This is nice for running in between my planted rows. I love that it is light weight and easy to control
customer_reviews.author: Margaret White

customer_reviews.title: good power
customer_reviews.text: The tiller has a lot of power. I have several raised beds and that is what I bought it for.
customer_reviews.author: STEVEN UNTERBORN

customer_reviews.title: Work great. You may need to purchase an extra battery ...
customer_reviews.text: Work great. You may need to purchase an extra battery depending on how large the yard is. Run time is about an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Online Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Battery Hard To Remove
customer_reviews.text: Battery too difficult to remove. Had to pry it out. Broke cover while attempting to remove the battery. No problems like this with other GreenWorks products I use.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Goldstraw

customer_reviews.title: Powerful enough for small to medium areas.
customer_reviews.text: My husband got this for me since I can't handle a big tiller. This one is easy to use and does a good job in already filled soil. I have a small garden, so the battery stayed charged for the entire job. This was just what I needed. Very handy.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Same Battery
customer_reviews.text: I got this in pretty fast. I haven't got a chance to use too much but I like it because it uses the same battery as my lawn mower and my Hedge Trimmer
customer_reviews.author: jesse whittington

customer_reviews.title: I use it all the time
customer_reviews.text: So far I love it. It is for small jobs, doesn't dig down well, but it's to be expected. I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: it's a great tool for the money and this fits in perfectly ...
customer_reviews.text: Works just as well as it's more expensive gasoline counterpart without the mess, stink, and failure of it's gas parts. Battery recharges in only 2 hours and runs for the entire 40 by 80 foot garden. It does not do well with compacted soil ,sod, or high weeds but if you allow it to go slow enough it will chop these up as well. Overall, it's a great tool for the money and this fits in perfectly with our off grid PV system. We also have the lawnmower and pruning saw in this series and are happy with everything. Goodbye gasoline!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl J Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Machine seems to have good power and sure is a delight to start once ...
customer_reviews.text: The first one I ordered did not work at all even after calling the manufacturer and trying everything over and over. The manufacturer agreed to send a second machine. i find the battery is a nightmare to get out to recharge and of course this needs to be done after ever use. Weeds can not be very tall or they wrap. Machine seems to have good power and sure is a delight to start once you get the battery in.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Gravert

customer_reviews.title: Carolyn O
customer_reviews.text: This is very nice small enough to get the small jobs done easy for me to work with. Grate for small flower garden
customer_reviews.author: CarolynO.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's extremely hard to get the battery out after use.
customer_reviews.author: ChristineVL

customer_reviews.title: Great for my vegetable garden.
customer_reviews.text: Once I figured out how to put on the blades I tried it out. Works great. Just right for the size of my garden. I had Greenworks chainsaw which uses the same batteries, so I didn't have to buy new batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Klein

customer_reviews.title: Works good for small jobs
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job for small jobs. This is not intended for a large area. Love the Greenworks lineup of tools.
customer_reviews.author: Vykon

customer_reviews.title: it is easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the little rototiller in June, 2017, for help with my gardening. I am 70 a year old woman and had no problem using it. I have very rocky soil, and although it jumps a little when it hits a rock, it is easy to handle. It saved me hours when I needed to dig out a trench for a path in my garden. I dug up the path area and then the dirt was easy to shovel out. I love it. So worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: sylvia heikkinen

customer_reviews.title: GreenWorks 27062 G-MAX Cordless Cultivator
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tiller for small gardens and flower beds. I really like the battery feature that eliminates mixing gasoline, getting the equipment started with the need for tune ups every spring, and draining fuel for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra A. Paulsen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for gardens, not for hard earth or stone, decent run time for a small battery
customer_reviews.author: Rocky

product_meta.title: Greenworks 10-Inch 40V Cordless Cultivator, 4.0 AH Battery Included 27062
product_meta.description: Size:6"Green works GMAX 40V 10 Inch Cultivator is the next alternative to its gas powered counterparts with reliable performance and dependability. This powerful cultivator can reliably make your job in the garden easier without the hassle of spilling gas and worrying about extension cords. Designed with robust features such as; four 8" adjustable tines for maximum tilling width of 8.25" to 10", adjustable tilling depth selector up to 5", large 6" rear wheels and durable gear drive transmission to handle tough areas with ease. Safety feature include an Easy Start 2-Step Switch to prevent accidental start ups and eliminates hard to manage gas pull cords. Operated by Green works powerful NEW GMAX 40V 2 AH Lithium-Ion battery, you can depend on this tiller to perform at the highest efficiency level and consistency throughout its entire run time of up to 40 minutes with ZERO carbon footprint in the yard. Increase your run time with our GMAX 40V 4 AH battery. Energy Star rated, you can charge your battery for $.04 or less, saving you money and avoid messing oil spills and extension cords. Green works light weight design makes this the ultimate cultivator and a great tool for the complete yard work solution.
feature_bullets: High Performance G-MAX 40V Lithium-Ion Battery delivers fade-free power with no memory loss after charging
4 adjustable 8-inch forward rotating tines for highest performance when digging into earth
Adjustable tilling width of 8.25-inch to 10-inch for quick reliable tilling
Tilling depth of up to 5-inch delivers fast results for your needs to promote a healthy garden
Compatible Only with G-MAX 40V Battery Models 29462 and 29472.Aggressive digging capabilities with up to 2000 strikes per minute for tough jobs

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars229 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
